consult.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to ask for information or advice from someone because it is their job to know something
consult.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: If symptoms persist, consult a doctor without delay.
An increasing number of people are consulting their accountants about the tax laws.
I need to consult with my lawyer.
consult.translation[0].definitions[0].no: In everyday English, people usually say ask someone, or see someone, rather than consult someone:
You need to ask your lawyer.
I think you should go and see your doctor.
consult.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to discuss something with someone so that you can make a decision together
consult.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: I can’t believe you sold the car without consulting me!
The president consulted with European leaders before taking action.
consult.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to look for information in a book, map, list etc
consult.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: to get advice from someone who is trained in a particular profession, for example a lawyer or a doctor
You should consult your lawyer before exchanging contracts.
to go to someone and ask them for for their advice, especially a professional person such as a lawyer or doctor. See is the usual word to use in everyday English
I think he needs to see a doctor.
Why don’t you go and see an accountant?
to ask someone to tell you what they think you should do in a particular situation
I asked my teacher’s advice when it was time to apply for colleges.
to ask someone whether something is correct or a good idea
Check with your doctor before starting on a new exercise program.
to go to someone to ask for help, advice, or sympathy
Many people who were struggling to repay mortgages turned to the Citizens’ Advice Bureau for help.
to ask someone who knows a lot about something for their ideas about it
The conference was a great place to meet other managers and pick their brains about issues I was also facing.
